nodes.codification: New York General Business Law Article 39-F §§ 899-aa and 899-bb
nodes.name: New York Stop Hacks and Improve Electronic Data Security (SHIELD) Act
nodes.description: The SHIELD Act is New York's data security and breach notification law that amends the state's Information Security Breach and Notification Act, expands the scope of 'private information', and requires any person or business that owns or licenses private information of New York residents to implement reasonable administrative, technical, and physical safeguards, enforced by the New York Attorney General.
nodes.base_regulation: New York Information Security Breach and Notification Act

nodes.name: Annual Risk Assessment
nodes.description: Formal annual risk assessment of data security

nodes.name: Data Classification Scheme
nodes.description: Classification of data by sensitivity level

nodes.description: Documented procedures for breach response

nodes.scope: All systems containing NY resident data
nodes.name: Internal Audit Team

nodes.description: Unauthorized access via compromised credentials
Ransomware infection encrypted databases
Accidental exposure via misconfigured S3 bucket

nodes.notification_content_includes: Breach description; Steps to take; Contact info

nodes.description: AES-256 encryption for data at rest and in transit

nodes.description: Social Security Number or tax ID

nodes.name: Driver License Number
nodes.description: Driver license or state ID number

nodes.name: Financial Account
nodes.description: Bank account or credit card with credentials

nodes.name: Biometric Data
nodes.description: Fingerprints, facial recognition, iris scan

nodes.name: Health Information
nodes.description: Medical diagnoses, treatment records

nodes.name: Credential Combination
nodes.description: Username/email + password/security question

nodes.name: Data Storage Risk Assessment
nodes.description: Assess risks to information storage and disposal

nodes.name: Intrusion Detection
nodes.description: Detect prevent and respond to intrusions

nodes.name: Unauthorized Access Prevention
nodes.description: Protect against unauthorized access/use during data lifecycle

nodes.name: Secure Disposal
nodes.description: Dispose of private information within reasonable time

nodes.elements: Name + (SSN OR Driver License OR Account #)
nodes.description: Traditional PII definition requiring a name identifier.
Allows access to an online account. Does NOT require a name.
Biometric data used for authentication.

nodes.name: Government Records
nodes.description: Information lawfully made available from federal state or local government records.

nodes.name: Widely Distributed Media
nodes.description: Information available via widely distributed media.

nodes.name: Personal Information
nodes.description: Broader category (Name Number Mark) that acts as a parent to Private Information.

nodes.name: New York Attorney General
nodes.description: The primary enforcer of the SHIELD Act.

nodes.name: NY Department of State
nodes.description: Receives notice of breaches.

nodes.name: NY State Police
nodes.description: Receives notice for criminal investigation purposes.

nodes.name: Consumer Reporting Agencies
nodes.description: Must be notified if breach affects >5000 residents.

nodes.name: Small Business Definition
nodes.description: Entity with <50 employees <$3M gross revenue or <$5M assets.

nodes.name: Security Violation Penalty
nodes.description: Civil penalty for failing to maintain reasonable safeguards (per violation).

nodes.name: Notification Violation Penalty
nodes.description: Civil penalty for failing to notify residents (capped at $250k).

nodes.name: Statute of Limitations
nodes.description: Action must be brought within 3 years of notice or 6 years of breach.

nodes.name: Inadvertent Disclosure
nodes.description: Good faith access by employee that does not result in further disclosure.

nodes.name: Unauthorized Access
nodes.description: Viewing communicating altering or using data without authorization.
